title: Ticket #7545: Monitoring a condor job via a separate time-scheduled condor job
description:
The parameter estimation (astrophysics inference) team here is interested in running a repeating job via condor that effectively monitors the output of a running condor job. I think they want something like this in a DAG

- start main processing job (MCMC) - start a second job that monitors the MCMC (makes HTML pages and plots), this should repeatedly execute every N minutes - when the MCMC job finishes, run one last instance of the monitoring job, then exit

Is still something easily configurable with a condor DAG and/or condor's time scheduling?
remarks:
2020-Mar-24 10:38:45 by pfc:
Peter C. will get more requirements (streaming, etc.) from and discuss with PE folks, and then report back here.

Options include: 

  * sidecar runs on execute side and streams results back
  * sidecar runs on execute side and chirps to job log
  * sidecar runs on submit side and inspects sandbox files being streamed back
  * sidecar runs on submit side and uses condor_ssh_to_job

Info can be "streamed" back via streaming i/o, chirp to classad, or chirp file xfer.

Would be good to split "how to get the monitor started" and "what does the monitor do?"

2020-Mar-24 10:42:05 by tlmiller:
With respect to scaling, no human is actually going to be looking at 10,000 separate graphs, so if that's the output, we can think about query-driven monitoring workflows.

2020-Mar-31 10:15:38 by pfc:
The ball is in Peter's court to clarify the PE use-case and requirements.

2020-Jun-30 10:38:36 by pfc:
Since the PE chairs haven't asked about this lately, demoting to priority 3.
